metadata.title: CVE-2014-8602 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
iterator.c in NLnet Labs Unbound before 1.5.1 does not limit delegationchaining, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(memory and CPU consumption) via a large or infinite number of referrals.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8602` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libunbound2 - 1.4.22-1ubuntu4.14.04.1
python-unbound - 1.4.22-1ubuntu4.14.04.1
unbound - 1.4.22-1ubuntu4.14.04.1
unbound-anchor - 1.4.22-1ubuntu4.14.04.1
unbound-host - 1.4.22-1ubuntu4.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unbound package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.22-1ubuntu4.14.04.1').
